content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really nice and original challenge

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Creative and visual, and a nice challenge for 5 minutes.

Your variable names are so long here. I guess it's so you can make reverse mode easier to solve, but it's a pain for fastest mode, because you spend time editing them.

This is a nice challenge, but it took me 9 minutes to solve. I think a lot of clashers would struggle to solve it in 15 minutes, let alone 5.
It's a lot easier to solve the similar problem where partial-words are allowed, but with whole-words only it becomes quite a challenge. (But the simpler version already has CoC's very similar to it submitted)

Your C# solution is 50 lines. I was able to write a Ruby solution in 10 lines, but it was a bit of a hacky approach. It does seem like this might be on the border of what's easy enough for a clash..

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: lgtm even in reverse
Didn't mrs Krabappel die in the series?
Nice; it works and (to me) instructions are clear enough. Solved in 5-6min.

Constraints section
* Please add "in [[phraseBartNeedsToWriteRepeatedly]]" after "longest word".

Thanks.

Oh geez... I didnt know that until I googled.  

Well let's pretend this was during one of the first 23 years that Bart was in 4th grade :)

Thank You :)
I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes I will approve clashes

My Ruby solution:
h = gets.to_i
w = gets.to_i
t = gets.split*99  # The hacky part
a = [[]]
h.times{ 
while (a[-1]+[t[0]]).join(" ").size <= w
  a[-1] << t.shift
end
a << [t.shift] } # Also a bit hacky
puts a[0,h].map{[?|,?|]*_1.join(" ").ljust(w) }
Thank you jddingemanse Thank you jddingemanse Thank you jddingemanse Thank you jddingemanse Thank you jddingemanse

Thank you.  (That makes my "inner-Lisa-Simpson" happy!) 

Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge Really nice and original challenge

Well, there is definitely a range of difficulty in the Clashes, and this is not the easiest for sure.

But also, definitely not hard enough for a "Classic puzzle"... so what to do.... what to do ???
